testsuite.name: Chrome 34.0.1847 (Mac OS X 10.9.2)

property.name: browser.fullName
property.value: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_9_2) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/34.0.1847.131 Safari/537.36

testcase.name: should be able to display an error message when username is not entered
testcase.classname: Chrome 34.0.1847 (Mac OS X 10.9.2).LoginClientSpec when validating empty username and password

testcase.name: should be able to display an error message when password is not entered
testcase.classname: Chrome 34.0.1847 (Mac OS X 10.9.2).LoginClientSpec when validating empty username and password

testcase.name: should be able to display an error message when username format is not correct
testcase.classname: Chrome 34.0.1847 (Mac OS X 10.9.2).LoginClientSpec when validating username format

testcase.name: should be able to display an error message when password format is not correct
testcase.classname: Chrome 34.0.1847 (Mac OS X 10.9.2).LoginClientSpec when validating password format

testcase.name: should be able to display an error message when username is not entered
testcase.classname: Chrome 34.0.1847 (Mac OS X 10.9.2).RegistrationClientSpec when validating empty username and password

testcase.name: should be able to display an error message when password is not entered
testcase.classname: Chrome 34.0.1847 (Mac OS X 10.9.2).RegistrationClientSpec when validating empty username and password

testcase.name: should be able to display an error message when passwords are not matched
testcase.classname: Chrome 34.0.1847 (Mac OS X 10.9.2).RegistrationClientSpec when validating matched passwords

testcase.name: should be able to display an error message when username format is not correct
testcase.classname: Chrome 34.0.1847 (Mac OS X 10.9.2).RegistrationClientSpec when validating username format

testcase.name: should be able to display an error message when password format is not correct
testcase.classname: Chrome 34.0.1847 (Mac OS X 10.9.2).RegistrationClientSpec when validating password format

testcase.name: should be able to register valid user correctly
testcase.classname: Chrome 34.0.1847 (Mac OS X 10.9.2).RegistrationClientSpec when user registration is done

testcase.name: should fail when a specific user id is already registered
testcase.classname: Chrome 34.0.1847 (Mac OS X 10.9.2).RegistrationClientSpec when user registration is done

testcase.name: should be able to get the weather of a valid location (Cairo)
testcase.classname: Chrome 34.0.1847 (Mac OS X 10.9.2).WeatherClientSpec when getting the weather information

testcase.name: should fail when getting the weather information of an invalid location
testcase.classname: Chrome 34.0.1847 (Mac OS X 10.9.2).WeatherClientSpec when getting the weather information

testsuite.system-out: Chrome 34.0.1847 (Mac OS X 10.9.2) LOG: 'Registration succeeded' ,Chrome 34.0.1847 (Mac OS X 10.9.2) LOG: 'Registration of duplicate user failed' ,Chrome 34.0.1847 (Mac OS X 10.9.2) LOG: 'Getting the weather of a valid location (Cairo) succeeded' ,Chrome 34.0.1847 (Mac OS X 10.9.2) LOG: 'Getting the weather information of an invalid location failed: 777'
